answer.q11Endpoints: Endpoints that return entity lists operate in pagination mode, so they are added to the pages.
answer.q11EntriesNumber: the number of entries returning on one page.
answer.q11PageNumber: the page number you want to get,
answer.q11Pagination: You can control the pagination using two GET parameters:
answer.q12FormatGetParameter: Use the GET parameter "format" to change the format of the returned data.
answer.q13: Pay for it by bank transfer for the use under the terms of the tariff. When choosing the Custom tariff, you will receive an invoice for payment by mail, according to the conditions established as a result of negotiations.
answer.q13SelectingPaidTariff: When selecting a paid tariff, an invoice is automatically generated. You will find it in the user profile in the section
answer.q15: To fill the Register we use the information, which is obtained within the implementation of the NGO "Anti-corruption Action Centre's" of its right to access public information, as well as information from open sources, which has already been made public. Specified information has not limited access and does not contain personal data within the meaning of the Law of Ukraine "On Protection of Personal Data" according to Paragraph 2 of Article 5 of this Law. At the same time, we cannot publish personally identifiable information, in particular personal identification codes.
answer.q1DOWorksWithPublicData: Data Ocean works with public data from government registries and other public information.
answer.q1GuaranteeCompliance: When working with data, we guarantee compliance with the requirements of special legislation of Ukraine in the personal data protection field.
answer.q2: As soon as you register for Data Ocean, you have free but limited access to the database. For full use of the database, we recommend choosing one of the
answer.q3InfoContainedInTheRegister: The information contained in the Register is based on evidence collected by the Anti-Corruption Action Centre from publicly available reliable
answer.q3TheUsageOfTheRegisterRecommended: The usage of the Register is recommended by the National Bank of Ukraine and the State Financial Monitoring Service of Ukraine as one of the information sources for the primary financial monitoring subject in the national public figures identification among their clients.
answer.q4DOIsATechnicalPartner:
Data Ocean is a technical partner of the Anti-Corruption Action Centre.
Data Ocean provides a technical support for the registry and both resources; it has the exclusive right to sell access to the PEP register for commercial organizations.
answer.q4InAdditionToPEPRegistry: In addition to the PEP registry, we work with other
answer.q4ProceedsFromTheSale: Proceeds from the sale are used to maintain and develop the registry.
answer.q5AccessThroughAPI: Access through the API is configured by technicians. Upon request, we can integrate it into your systems.
answer.q5AnAPIRequestIs: An API request is your software's single access to our server using JSON or XML data. It is convenient for an integration into corporate systems, when all processes and database updates are automatic.
answer.q6:
No. You can upload up to 100 objects (for example, PEPs and related persons) in one API request. This is usually enough to get a database update per day. 
For one-time registry uploading + receiving regular updates, we recommend subscribing to the
answer.q7AccessToken: you will find an access token:
answer.q7InTheUserProfile: in the user profile in the section
answer.q7MainAnswer: In order to access the API, you need to add a regular title called "Authorization" meaning "DataOcean 94c6d542af1c4c4942e51df6с4d47fbd12fb3dea " to your HTTP request by substituting your token.
answer.q8: With the help of API-requests it is possible to obtain an up-to-date list of public figures on the current date in XML or JSON format. Access through the API also allows you to configure the receipt of only the data you need, it all depends on the technical implementation. For example, you can only receive updates in the PEP database per day.
